summary:
M - ENB is a dark and cinematic fantasy preset harnessing the latest binaries and effects.
With custom ENB weathers and heavy use of ambient color filtering, players will experience
different moods and atmospheres depending on the time of day, weather type, and location.
Compatible with Night Eye, Predator Vision and Better Vamp
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-_Ihxy1_fJEc/U5NKWF1C0QI/AAAAAAAACa8/z9r3Z47OIuI/w661-h331-no/M+-+ENB+Logo.png[/img][/center][center][img]https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-npzbERZTt6Q/U5NJjbL5ksI/AAAAAAAACao/8SF8eZxYbsM/w1018-h69-no/M+ENB+Nexus+Installation.png[/img][/center]
[center][color=#C0C0C0] [youtube]FHCYoVB8P_Y[/youtube]


1. Download the latest v0305 binaries or higher from [url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.htm]enbdev.com
[/url]
2. Open the "Wrapper" folder included. Copy & Paste only the d3d9.dll and enbhost into your main Skyrim folder as shown below:


[center][img]https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-iGZOVWRAQTs/U5NZeE82lwI/AAAAAAAACcE/H5VGNYeCV7M/w991-h404-no/Binary+Copy+and+Paste.PNG[/img][/center]

3. Download my M-ENB preset from the files section.

Once downloaded, copy & paste only the "enbseries" folder, enblocal, and enbseries files into your main Skryim folder as shown below:


[center][img]https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-COh9w0-WRFc/U5NZfQo69WI/AAAAAAAACcY/8b_fu9FMZ3M/w991-h405-no/Preset+copy+and+paste.PNG[/img][/center]

4. Open up the enblocal file as a txt. and adjust the videomemorysize= under [Memory].
For 32 bit OS users with less than 8GB of RAM, use this formula [VRAM + SYSTEM RAM] - [2048]
or
For 64-bit, If you have 8GB RAM or more, use this formula [Total Available Graphics Memory] - [170] for Windows 7 users
For 64-bit, If you have 8GB RAM or more, use this formula [Total Available Graphics Memory] - [350] for Windows 8/10 users

To figure out your Total Available Graphics Memory, use [url=http://www.computerhope.com/issues/ch001307.htm]quick guide that takes less than a minute[/url].

 There is also an autodetect setting in here as well if you are really unsure how to do this, which is the easiest way but not recommended.
Watch my tutorial video embedded above or check out the S.T.E.P. Wiki on ENBoost for more information.

5. If you want the custom ENB Snow FX as seen in the videos and screenshots, now is the time to download the optional ENB Data files from the files section of the mod page. This is Nexus Mod Manager compatible for simple installation. It contains a single ESP you can activate for Mindflux's amazing falling snow FX to work. 

6. Make the following adjustments in your Skyrim pref inis: (You can find this under Documents/Games/Skyrim) 
If these values are not there, you can write them in yourself as long as they are under the [Display] section.

[Display]
------------------------------------
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1
bShadowsOnGrass=1
bTreesReceiveShadows=1
bDrawShadows=1

7. Turn off hardware anti-aliasing & anisotropic filtering. ENB handles both of these.
You can also do this in the Skyrim Launcher OR the Skyrim Pref files as well (recommended)
You are better off doing them while you are in the Skyrim Pref inis anyway.

[Display]
-----------------------------------

      iMultisample=0       (Antialiasing)
                   iMaxAnisotropy=1   (Anisotropic Filtering)

[center][img]https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-LA9QlluqeZM/UzerJn-7RhI/AAAAAAAABwQ/_cnqcLVyd_g/w874-h425-no/skyrim+launcher+settings.JPG[/img][/center]

8. Launch the game and enjoy. I'd love to see your lovely screenshots :).

[center][img]https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-quTofN9YFPg/U5NZeXSBvcI/AAAAAAAACcI/qJnEHwH2xLA/w1018-h69-no/Recommended+Mods.png[/img][/center]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/42392]Candle Glow[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34886]Lorkan's Vision[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18916]Lanterns of Skyrim[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41076]Realistic Water Two by Isoku[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/40564]SkyFalls and SkyMills - Animated Distant Waterfalls and Windmills[/url]

This preset is not compatible with any weather changing mods. I made custom ENB weathers that would conflict.

[center][img]https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/-ZoP9O4g10eg/U5NZc1rK1JI/AAAAAAAACb0/2k9XzSJ0l6M/w1018-h69-no/Credits.png[/img][/center]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/45054]Amoebae[/url] - for the Lens Dirt Textures
[url=http://enbdev.com/]Boris Vorotsov[/url] - for creating the enbseries and making ENB presets possible.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50065]Confidence Man[/url] - I learned everything about ENB weathers from cracking open your beautiful preset & weather files.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/196978]-Jawz-[/url] - for the atmosphere mesh & providing invaluable resources for those new to ENB. I have a lot of respect for you.
Tansarville - for creating the original Somber Lut Sepia ENB & enbeffect file, for which this preset is based on.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46871]Matso[/url] - for not only inspring me to create ENB presets with Project Matso, but providing code and advice.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3211380]Mindflux aka Artem1s[/url] - for the essential particle patch, and beautiful custom snow FX
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3389970]Wolfgrimdark[/url] - For providing permission as the current manager of Somber Lut Sepia to use the enbeffect file.
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50638]ZeroKing[/url] - for your incredible Post Processing shaders effect file. The preset would be the same without this.
Andrej Dudenhefner - For creating the original SMAA injector used by many of us here.
Christian Jensen - For creating the powerful yet simple SweetFX suite.
CaptainSkullSaber for the Palettes
Kingeric for the weather effects and sunsprite shader.
[b]scegielski for the Enhanced ENB Night Eye code[/b]

[center][img]https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/-8arELrlEvQg/U5NgvGfsrnI/AAAAAAAACcs/UUO8-wy8AQU/w1018-h69-no/Special+Thanks.png[/img][/center]
Thank you WolfGrimDark for beta testing, feedback, screenshots, support, advice, & for being a good friend.
Thank you to my friends & fellow YouTubers Hodilton, Slytra, and MCD Reviews for the beautiful videos showcasing my preset. 
Thank you to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/4591952]MACHIIMACHII[/url] for beta testing & creating beautiful cinematic presets such as Poupouri & Saraan Suum ENB, some of my favorites.
[/color][/center]
author: Sloth

files.name: Custom Snow FX and ENB Particle Patch
